comments.text:
Comment on attachment 519438 Remove WCAG 2.0 violations in the header page > >-

[% terms.Bugzilla %] >- [% " – $header" IF header %]

>+ [% terms.Bugzilla %] >+ [% " – $header" IF header %] > Hum, I guess this is going to linkify "Bugzilla" in the header, which we don't want. Also, I personally don't think this would be the expected behavior when clicking on this link. >+[% END %] Syntax error: has no >.
comments.creator: LpSolit@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
> >-

[% terms.Bugzilla %] >- [% " – $header" IF header %]

>+ [% terms.Bugzilla %] >+ [% " – $header" IF header %] > Hum, I guess this is going to linkify "Bugzilla" in the header, which we don't want. Also, I personally don't think this would be the expected behavior when clicking on this link. >+[% END %] Syntax error: has no >.

Having a skip to main content link would be very useful to a user using screen readers, so they don't have to listen to the entire header every time. Maybe instead of linkify in the header "Bugzilla - page", just linkfy "page", maybe with a title "skip to main content" to make it more intuitive. Something like this: [% terms.Bugzilla %] [% " – "%] [% "$header" IF header %] Or maybe we could put a new link. Could be visible or hidden. What do you think? Do you have another suggestion?
